review: In einem Anflug nostalgischer Schwelgerei im Angebot für 74 Cent geschossen. Installiert und hab's schon im Menü anne Nerven bekommen! Einmal per Alt+Tab minimiert, ließ es sich nicht wieder vernünftig aufrufen und musste neu gestartet werden. Wenn ich also irgendwann mal zwischendurch was nachsehen wollen würde, hätt ich's jedes Mal neu starten müssen. Tastenbelegung ließ sich nicht individuell konfigurieren und ist strikt vorgegeben. Und das auch noch ziemlich beknackt: Pause shift+P. Einmal aus Gewohnheit/Versehen zum Abpausen auf Esc, wird der aktuelle Schritt übersprungen und es gibt kein Zurück. Ergo: nochmal von vorn. Meine Kristallkugel sagte mir, dass das im Spielverlauf mit Sicherheit nicht besser wird. Der kleine Autist in mir windet sich zwar, wenn ich die X-Reihe dann eben mit dem 2. Teil starte, aber das Leben ist für sowas echt zu kurz. Daher kann ich mich dem Urteil "nur für Spiele-Archäologen interessant" wohl anschließen. Früher war eben doch nicht alles besser. ^^

Играл в неё в год выхода в 1999 и это было круто. Увидел, что она есть в Steam и купил не задумываясь. Как же здорово опять ощутить себя в шкуре пилота-испытателя, которого закинуло неизвестно куда и нифига непонятно, как попасть обратно на Землю!
camera way too jank so I couldn't bring myself to play very far

Un jeu de tir/strategie/commerce un peu comme Elite dans son temps , mais avec un scenario assez basique : vous etes loin dans un univers inconnu et vous voulez rentrer chez vous mais rien va se passer comme vous voudriez....

Les graphismes sont surdates mais l animation reste fluide et bonne , premier bemol viendra que le jeu est en anglais et surtout aucuns soustitres lors des discussions c est plutot hard... Deuxieme bemol : impossible de remapper les touches vous devez faire avec et oubliez direc une manette pour y jouer , c est pas prevu !

A part ca le jeu est assez simpa et le combats spatiaux sont nets et lisibles et le jeu offre une grande liberte d action

Interet : 12/20
Realisation : 12/20

This was an important game.
Do not get my "not recommended" wrong.
I enjoyed it back in the day and even when I replayed it.

The truth is, though: Every other game in the X Series:
X-Tension
X²
x³
X³-TC
X⁴
is better, And even if u want a slow and restricting game with unintuitive input, just go for x-rebirth.

Im besten Fall empfehlenswert für Nostalgiker und selbst hier macht man sich vielleicht nur die Erinnerung kaputt.

Ja - das Spiel ist schlecht gealtert. Ja es funktioniert nur richtig mit einer 4:3 Auflösung. Ja die Steuerung ist bißchen gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber nach über 20 Jahren.

Hauptproblem ist hier aber nicht die Steuerung sondern das Gameplay selber. 

Allein der Start zieht sich wie Kaugummi, zu wenig Geld und kein Zeitverzerrungsantrieb JEDER weg dauert wirklich Ewigkeiten. Dazu noch horrende Preise für alles.

Selbst wenn man hier nie ein Remaster oder Remake kommt (welches hier wirklich verdient wäre), könnte ich erst eine positive Empfehlung geben, wenn es zumindest die Option gäbe den Start etwas zu Beschleunigen. Zum Beispiel sofort ein Zeitverzerrungsantrieb und einfach etwas mehr Startkapital. Bonus wären noch die Erweiterung des Zeitverzerrungsantriebes auf die doppelte Geschwindigkeit o.Ä. und einfach mehr Frachtraum.

Meinem Verständnis nach sollte das nicht das große Problem sein, wenn sie schon in der Lage sind eine Kompatibilität mit Win 10 und Win 12 zu erreichen.

Get into trading, get SETA, pay your debt. Get money for a teladianium factory, put one in seizewell, two in family zein, you can put two more deep into split territory, and a couple more in blue profit. Explore all sectors, come back and collect money to become filthy rich. Buy the best gear, tune your engine at pirate bases about 12-13 times. There, you can now finish the story. Great game, only took me 17 years and 4 restarts to finish. 10/10
building growing fighting with a little trading

This game is hard to play, but it has THE vibe. It's very unique in many ways haha I would probably recommend people to try X-Tension if anybody wants to play some very retro space game with strategy and economy elements or just old X game. But this one has the OG story.

First time trying to play the game and boy oh  boy is this ancient PoS even with a compatibility patch for modern PC not working went around the internet different internet forums and no one has the issues I have it looks like my graphics in the game are a pixel explosion I have tried every possible setting to get it working. I have tried outside guides even a tool to try and fix it lo and behold nothing. 

At this point they should really limit the sales of this game, make it free, or re-make it for modern day as I have no way to play the first game in the series other than trying to buy an ancient laptop.

Aktuelle Spielequeue:
https://rsg.ditomido.de
Vorgeschlagen von: Rittersternchen

Unter Vorvbehalt empfehlenswert, für Nostalgiker

Zunächst einmal muss man beachten, dass es sich hier um ein 25 Jahre altes Spiel handelt. Was man dabei gerne mal vergistt: die Nutzerfreundlichkeit, Konfigurationsmöglichkeiten, sowie die Einführungsmethoden wie Tutorials etc. waren damals einfach anders und häufig auf das Handbuch ausgelagert. Insofern gut, dass es auch über "weitere Inhalte" bzw. anhand der Wiki Verlinkung auf der Shopseite mit angeboten wird. (sogar im old school quadratischem Bookletformat pdf)

Ich denke für 1999 ist die Grafik echt gut, die Steuerung gewöhnungsbedürftig und das Konzept super interessant. Als freier gestrandeter Erdling zum Weltraumwarenhandel gezwungen zu werden klingt schon ziemlich spannend und absurd. Leider hatten wir in den 30 Minuten antesten eher einen Kampf mit der Steuerung bzw. der Konfiguration dieser. Daher konnten wir bis zuletzt nicht wirklich das eigentliche Spiel spielen. Alles rundum wirkte aber wirklich spannend, besonders wenn man etwas schummelt und sich den Halo Soundtrack parallel noch dazuschaltet, den selbst wenn X: Beyond the Frontier voll auf Deutsch vertont ist, merkt man doch den stark komprimierten Soundtrack von damals.

Falls sich das Spiel wieder in unserem Glücksrat finden lässt, lass ich mich mich gerne zu einem Reviewupdate überzeugen, aber da der einstieg doch sehr klobig war, muss ich mit der Bewertung entsprechend urteilen.

Ganz schlimm war jedoch die Tastenbelegungskonfiguration. Die hatte bei mir nicht richtig funkioniert und mich zu einem kompletten Shutdown gezwungen, da mein system ausgehebelt wurde und Alt F4 sowie taskmanager keine Lösung boten.

Rating:
Dito: 3.4/5
Chat: 2.25/5
Gesamt: 2.83/5
immer noch ein Super Game. Wie schon seit über 20 Jahren :)

Zum x ten mal installiert und endlich geschafft nach bald 25jahren durch zu spielen. Also was heißt das. 
Naja Story ist zwar kurz , aber man muss paar Farbiken haben um die teure Ausrüstung zu kaufen. 36Stunden hat es mich an den Bildschirm mal wieder gefesselt. Das Spiel ist aus der Sicht der Nostalgie okay, aber Neulinge sollten dass eher neuere Teile spielen. Ist doch etwas schlecht gealtert. Selbst mit den dicksten Schild im Spiel wackelt mein ganzes Raumschiff wenn nen Jäger mich mit den poppeligsten Laser trifft und selbst krieg ich nen eleptischen Anfall wenn ich mit egal welcher waffe selber schieße...das nervte an meisten.
Aber trotz dessen liebe ich die Musik und diese Ruhe meistens. Jetzt ist X2 an der Reihe <3

it might be good if you played this game eons ago, but today it's very hard to figure out all that crap. Like how do u even dock or land on a station, you're just basically ignored by anything and the hotkey to hail(C) doesn't do much.
The controls are weird, but can get used to(to some degree).
The game talks about some different type of stations and there are different icons on the radar as well, but there is no chance that you will ever figure out what the hell is what.
There is a manual and a walkthough file in C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\X Beyond the Frontier
And you can watch a video to figure all this crap out, but too much work for so little fun. Can't really recommend it.
Primitive & flawed.

I used to love this game back in the day, but when I tried to replay it recently (Steam was having a 4X event, and it gave me the itch to replay this old friend), it kept crashing every few minutes. Obviously this makes the game unplayable, so I don't recommend it.
Pretty much endless replayability! Mod the ships, and get a endless selection of races you can pit against eachother.

While I like the game, I am bias as I loved it when it came out.  A lot of the game often comes down to micromanagement of resources but that entertains me.  It is more about management than combat the the later has some fun too.  Combat can be fun when you are faced with a superior number of enemy ships but your weapons have a longer range.  With the pausable real time combat you can maneuver your ships to stay just out of range and grind down the enemy.  And considering the game is nearly 20 years old, the visuals aren't too bad.  And with the exploring new systems as you expand, I am addicted to the just one more turn....

One last fun note, the game runs better on linux today than modern windows.  There are many posts out there on how to full screen the game in Win10/11 but it natively full screened for me in Linux (Fedora 42).  I just encountered one quirk where I had to remove the innitial R on all .bmp files (there is a post in the community for it, File is Missing...) but then it played perfectly.

This game is a serious retrograde step. SEIV was clear and concise.  This is covered in dancing salami.  Nothing is clear.  It may be an improvement in game play, but I'll never know as I can't be bothered to play this cluster.
Игра всех времен и народов!

A classic 4X game that was one of the most moddable games in its time.  Users can easily write text mods for everything.  Python scripting allowed for non-core game mechanics to be added though significant, lengthy changes could produce end turn lag as they are processed after the core code.  Still, want a hyperspace jump drive - script it. Want the ability to create shelled Dyson sphere planets - write the text and introduce it.  Combat mechanics are somewhat primitive but given its age numerous user mods were created that made the AI better.  At one point I scripted a supernova type event that would damage other stars, planets and colonies in a X-light year radius (a timed, random event) complete with a stellar stabilization tech that could be used to mitigate its impact.  Your imagination is the limit.

Played this as it was being made. Bought it when it came out.  Lost my copy, Bought on Steam on sale with Space Empires IV.

It remains broken.
The diplomacy hasn't been fixed. -It is impossible to vote.
Many features don't work (warp points too small to fit ships? Not checked for).
Even on a new PC this game barely chuggs along once you get to a small Empire.
It's got NO optimization at all, and quickly grinds to to point of needing to wait 20 seconds for EACH window to open.

A HARD PASS.  Even on Sale, not worth it.

Go get Space Empires IV instead.  It Works.
The graphics are not as shiny, but you can Play the Game.

I've gotten 3 copies of this game because it's just that good, two on CD and this copy on Steam. The culmination of the Space Empires series, it's a wonderful game with a lot of depth. Unfortunately, it does come with some bugs and balance issues, most of which can be fixed with Captain Kwok's Balance Mod. Absolutely worth checking out!

Still have my cd for this and SEIV both great games recommend this both but this one has better combat visuals and the same depth/mod friendliness. A good comparison game is Stelllaris which with its dlc has more than vanilla SEV with out mods, but there are mods aplenty and this is 9$.
Yes.
平衡MOD都更新到2.7了，跟原版游戏简直是两个游戏，比群星好玩多了

This space opera simulator was a labor of love by its developers. For its age, it still has a complexity and attention to detail that modern games significantly lack. Its a pain to learn and setup yet eventually you'll bear the fruits of your labor in the form of your envisioned space empire. Highly customizable near to a fault. Never ending Tech Tree with unique paths. Countless ways to approach victory. The Steam overlay does at times cause the game to crash albeit seldom. Wish this game, had a modern update to improve the bit graphics. The greatest area of focus is the space ship design to function, to be arranged in fleets and organized tactically, a sight to see when you have hundreds to thousands of units raining havoc upon your foes.
good game , replayable
Good turned based strategy..  quite an old title but still worth coming back to.
Amazing complexity of governing empire and fleet
musique très répétitive, interface datée, un très mauvais choix de nos jours
This seems pretty good.  I'm playing Space Empires IV more and more and got back into this one too.

While I like the complexity of options and the level of control you have over ship design, this game did not age well since I last played it when it was new, and I don't mean graphically.

I was greeted by a host of technical issues. At first the game simply refused to even start. Once I figured that out, I still get hit by random crashes that aren't that uncommon, along with times where the FPS of this ancient game drops down really low and it just runs terrible. I have to restart. I have multiple monitors and while the game's launcher lets you select which monitor it plays on, if I change it away from the default the game doesn't load. At least it defaults to my main monitor.

What is interestingly bizarre is the game seems to configure itself using elements from all attached displays. It'll run on monitor 1, using the max resolution of monitor 2, and locks itself at the minimum refresh rate of the attached TV. 

So if my TV is connected to my PC, the game locks itself at 30fps for some reason even though the TV is set for 60Hz. If I disable the TV in NVIDIA control panel, it goes up to the refresh rate of my main monitor at 144. So I have to disable the extra displays even if it's not using them. Tedious, but oddly fascinating.

I like most of the music from this game, but it and the effects sound almost like you're listening to them through a phone. Perhaps the engine just has a low quality sound engine? It's odd because if I go into the game folder and listen to the MP3s of the music tracks, they sound fine. It's only in game where they sound a bit muffled and with low fidelity.

The game itself despite being run on a PC that is so much more powerful than what was available at the time the game was made, it still runs poorly. From random losses of FPS, to sustained losses of FPS that are only resolved by restarting the game, to your ship list menu freezing the game upwards of 7-10 seconds before it opens even if you have about only two dozen ships on the list. The AI turn processing time start getting fairly lengthy as well, with all the issues all compounding together it really make it more difficult to enjoy playing.

However, I get too many random crashes that have no obvious cause or correlation between them that I can't solve, so I can't recommend this game. Keep in mind this was after messing with it for quite a long time to get it to even load in the first place.


It's a shame there was never a sequel that refined the experience, underneath all the jank and technical issues, there is a pretty solid premise for a game.


If you still want to try it, only get it on sale and make sure you use a mod that improves the AI like CaptainKwok's Balance mod. The base game AI isn't good.

This game is awful. It is ancient, buggy, unstable and requires mods to make it remotely playable. It doesn't have half the features Stellaris has. I don't know how I've played it for 600 hours or how the ship design and combat is somehow better then games with 100x the budget and time. This game is a trap. You need to not play it. In fact, you need to run, right now before this buggy crap takes 600 from you too. It's too late for me, save yourself!
Old but interesting with still one or two active modders keeping things fresh.
